front.title: Registration of Second-Level URI Namespaces Under "ietf"

abstract.t: RFC 2648 defines the "ietf" URN namespace, and defines a number of sub-namespaces. RFC 3553 defines an additional sub-namespace, "params", and creates a registry to document allocations under that. But there is no registry that lists, in one place, all sub-namespaces of "ietf". This document creates and populates such a registry.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: "A URN Namespace for IETF Documents" defines the "ietf" URN namespace, and defines a number of sub-namespaces. "An IETF URN Sub-namespace for Registered Protocol Parameters" defines an additional sub-namespace, "params", and creates a registry to document allocations under that. But there is no registry that lists, in one place, all sub-namespaces of "ietf". This document creates and populates such a registry, and updates RFC 2648 and RFC 3553 to refer readers of those documents to this registry.

section.title: IANA Considerations
section.t: There is currently a top-level registry group called "IETF Protocol Parameter Identifiers", which contains one registry, "IETF URN Sub-namespace for Registered Protocol Parameters". IANA is asked to take the following three actions:

Action 1: Rename the group "IETF Protocol Parameter Identifiers", giving it the new name "Uniform Resource Name (URN) Namespace for IETF Use". The existing registry in that group will remain, and its name will be unchanged.

Action 2: Add a new registry to the renamed group. The new registry will be called "IETF URN Sub-namespaces", and new registrations will use the IETF Review policy , which provides for IETF consensus in order to add a new URN namespace under "ietf".

Action 3: Populate the new registry as follows:
